title: Application Support Analyst
description: Inovalon was founded in 1998 on the belief that technology, and data specifically, would empower the transformation of the entire healthcare ecosystem for the better, improving both outcomes and economics. At Inovalon, we believe that when our customers are successful in their missions, healthcare improves. Therefore, we focus on empowering them with data-driven solutions. And the momentum is building. Together, as ONE Inovalon, we are a united force delivering solutions that address healthcare's greatest needs. Through our mission-based culture of inclusion and innovation, our organization brings value not just to our customers, but to the millions of patients and members they serve.Overview: The Application Support Analyst will be responsible for providing in-depth analysis, technical support for application software, operating systems and integrated third party products to external and internal customers. Manages progress toward resolution and documents customer communication throughout the "life-cycle" of a reported issue. Works closely with Technical Support and Engineering teams on complex issues. Duties and Responsibilities: Perform technical troubleshooting of complex issues to resolution documenting all solutions; Perform defect analysis and provide support to Technical Support, Application &amp; Operations Support (AOS) and Engineering teams to resolve issues impacting customers; Address requests in priority order and track through to resolution; Ensure a consistent response to problem resolution, customer requests and status reporting, and monitor all issues to ensure a timely resolution; Identify and suggest necessary solutions or process changes to improve efficiency; Contribute to product improvements by sharing ideas and feedback to product development; Perform updates to application configurations and apply database updates; Using application monitoring toolsets, develop and maintain application log search indexes and monitors to assist in troubleshooting application issues; Contribute to the development and maintenance of tools and support methods for improvement of our products and services; Proactively analyze, monitor, and search application data for application issues; Develop knowledge base articles for AOS and Technical Support teams; Maintain compliance with Inovalon's policies, procedures and mission statement; Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within Inovalon's Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position; and Fulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon for the purpose of achieving operational and financial success of the Employer. Job Requirements: Minimum 2 years' experience of in a technical support related role in a mixed environment of Windows and Linux; Minimum 1-year experience in a Healthcare support environment; Minimum 1-year experience with basic system administration tasks in Linux and Microsoft Windows servers; and Minimum 2 years' experience using, supporting, or configuring SFTP, REST API, TCPIP, and SQL. Ability to demonstrate detailed knowledge of specific product offerings, O/S skills or internal systems; Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; Self-motivated with strong organizational/prioritization skills and ability to multi-task with close attention to detail; Good communication skills are essential. Must be able to give and receive correct information explain difficult information and maintain a customer service attitude to all levels of users; Ability to work well in a team environment as well as to work independently and assume responsibility; A desire to continue learning and improving. After hours On-call Support - Part of rotation that supports products during non-business hours. (one week every 4-6 weeks). Preferred Qualifications: Healthcare IT industry experience (medical billing, IT, CMS or other payers ); Experience using Salesforce; Experience demonstrating technical proficiencies in Redhat Linux (CentOS ); Experience with Splunk, SolarWinds, ELK, or other monitoring tools; Experience using scripting languages; bash, Jscript, JavaScript, Perl, Python, etc.; Experience working with basic server architecture and virtual machines; and Experience with EDI formats. Education: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, MIS, related field or equivalent work experience; Physical Demands and Work Environment: Sedentary work (i.e. sitting for long periods of time); Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force; Frequently or constantly to lift, carry push, pull or otherwise move objects and repetitive motions; Subject to inside environmental conditions; and Travel for this position will include less than 0% locally usually for training purposes. Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications listed in a job description. If you don't meet every qualification listed but are excited about our mission and the work described, we encourage you to apply regardless. Inovalon is most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and you may be just the right person for this or other roles. By embracing diversity, equity and inclusion we enhance our work environment and drive business success. Inovalon strives to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate and of our clients and everyone whom we serve. We endeavor to create a culture of inclusion in which our associates feel empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work and pursue their professional goals in an equitable setting. We understand that by fostering this type of culture, and welcoming different perspectives, we generate innovation and growth. Inovalon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirement. The Company maintains a drug free work environment for all of its associates, which includes employees, contractors and vendors. It is unlawful for associates to manufacture, sell, distribute, dispense, possess or use any controlled substance or marijuana in the workplace and doing so will result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment or the contracted relationship.PDN-994381f5-ef1f-491c-9215-b8ffe020ce56

description: The Enterprise Cloud Team is looking for a Cloud Engineer with hands-on Microsoft Azure cloud engineering experience and <strong>required Databricks infrastructure, performance, hands-on.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is for USA.</li><li>Candidate must be located either close to Chicago, or Northern New Jersy, or New York city</li><li>Must be able to visit office at least once a month in corresponding location</li><li>Direct hire only.</li><li>Salary range from $90 K - $125 K.</li><li>AZ-104 or higher (REQUIRED)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The ideal candidate has experience working in hybrid (cloud &amp; on-prem) environments, and multi-cloud if possible, building and maintaining cloud group and subscription hierarchies, building and securing cloud-based infrastructure, supporting application runtime environments, architecting solutions and comfortable collaborating and communicating with engineers at all levels of the datacenter stack to implement complicated architectures and designs, while being hands-on as needed.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be a quick learner of our infrastructure/environment, proactive in taking on tasks and not afraid to assume ownership of the tasks, end-to-end.</li><li>The candidate must be a “do-er" not a follower and must be willing to provide commentary and opinion on just about any cloud-related topic.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve Databricks environment performance issues, connectivity issues, security issues. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Experience in setting up “Admin Group" and give user admin privileges, adding them to admins group using Admin Console, Groups API 2.0, SCIM API 2.0 or using SCIM-enabled identity provider. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Experience as “Databricks workspace Admin", who manage workspace users and groups including single sign-on, provisioning, access to Databricks SQL, and access control and workspace storage. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Work with Application and Solution Architects, Software Engineers &amp; Infrastructure Engineers to solve technical and operational challenges, drive efficiency and provide high complexity, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility.</li><li>Act as the technical liaison between operational and development teams, providing critical operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, including validation of ongoing solutions supportability.</li><li>Stay well-informed of failures and complications related to our cloud offerings.</li><li>Be responsible for debugging technical issues inside a complex stack involving virtualization, containers, micro-services, etc.</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to enable their applications to migrate to and run on Cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Work with automation team to maintain Automation scripts / tools created to support monitoring and automation of operational support.</li><li>Manage and Support cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.</li><li>Strong implementation and support of APIs to troubleshoot RESTful services and integration of them with consumers.</li><li>Extensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineering.</li><li>Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.</li><li>Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required.</li><li>Lead and develop best practices and runbooks for use by operations and escalations teams</li><li>Stay current with industry trends, contributing to recommendations as needed to help the company excel.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering; Master's degree a plus.</li><li>Certification as an Azure cloud vendors, primarily Microsoft Azure, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS).</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting micro-service and server-less design concepts and patterns.</li><li>Proven design, planning and implementation experience with all infrastructure components including Storage, Network and Compute technologies.</li><li>Experience working with Azure App Service, Azure Policy and Security Center - diagnosing and remediating resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs.</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining Azure Management Group hierarchies, Subscriptions, Resource Groups, employing out-of-the-box and custom Roles and Policies to support “minimal privileges" and “separation of responsibilities leveraging code repository tools such as GIT, CI/CD tools such as GitLab CI, image repositories such as Artifactory and Azure DevOps, Azure Data Flow pipelines.</li><li>Hands-on experience with infrastructure and configuration management scripting tools and solutions - Hashicorp Terraform (required), Puppet, Chef, Ansible, CF templates, ARM.</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting complex cloud security patterns, integrating on-premises and cloud security services, including encryption keys, certificates, PKI, CA, HSM's, key/secrets and Key Management Vault services.</li><li>Coding and scripting experience using PowerShell, Python, Linux command-line shells such as Bash, korn, YAML and JSON, Cloud APIs, etc.</li><li>Comfortable coding in a polyglot asynchronous micro-service APIs using infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Excellent understanding of terminology and concepts across popular public cloud services, including the “cloud computing stack," i.e., Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as third-party services including Databricks, Snowflake, ElasticSearch.</li><li>Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and experience working with Machine Learning services such as SparkML, pySpark, Scikit, Tensor, GPUs, etc.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Containerization technologies including Azure AKS, Redhat ARO/Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, EKS.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting data analytics platforms (including Data Lakes and Data Hubs) based on Hadoop/Hive/Spark family, Cloudera, HortonWorks, SnowFlake.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting SQL, NoSQL and document databases, including complex queries, PL/SQL.</li><li>Experience with implementing and automating on-premise private cloud technologies such as OpenShift, Pivotal and custom Automation tooling.</li><li>Ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Self-motivated and skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to assist clients both internal and external and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace.</li><li>Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams and lead and mentor less experienced engineers-Strong awareness of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks.</li><li>Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues with a variety of cloud vendors and services using cloud infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!

title: Linux Cryptography and Security Engineer
description: This is a unique opportunity to use your cryptography and certification skills to enable Ubuntu and its users to operate securely and to remain compliant to FIPS 140 and Common Criteria standards. You will use your applied cryptography, Linux Security, and coding skills to enhance the Ubuntu distribution and work with DISA and CIS to help draft Ubuntu STIGs and Ubuntu CIS benchmarks.<br><br>You will work with and support the team to develop automation tooling for making Ubuntu systems STIG and CIS benchmark compliant and audit the systems for compliance. You will work with the team to achieve new compliance and certifications for Ubuntu as needed. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on direction and execution.<br><br>The successful candidate will collaborate with Canonical's kernel and security teams to extend and enhance the Ubuntu distribution with the features necessary to achieve and retain FIPS and CC certification.<br><br><strong>What You'll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Support the Security Certifications engineers to achieve and retain various Security certifications</li><li>Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components - specifically with modules such as OpenSSL/Libgcrypt - with the features and functionality required for FIPS and CC certification</li><li>Collaborate with external security consultants to test and validate kernel and crypto components, achieve and retain FIPS and CC certification</li><li>Work with external partners to develop CIS benchmarks and hardening automation for Ubuntu</li><li>Contribute to Ubuntu mainline and upstream projects to land solutions and benefit the community</li><li>Communication and collaboration within and outside Canonical to rapidly resolve issues and keep the project on track</li><li>Required Skills and Experience</li><li>Significant experience working with open source libraries</li><li>Development experience of Linux Security and Cryptography</li><li>Hands on experience working with public key cryptography</li><li>Experience with patching and associated tooling: identifying, isolating, applying and testing patches, and resolving any resulting issues</li><li>General Linux development skills (C proficiency, git experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Who You Are<br></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of and familiarity with low-level Linux cryptography APIs and debugging</li><li>Experience working with Linux Kernel</li><li>Knowledge of security benchmarks such as STIG and CIS benchmarks. </li><li>Security Certification experience and knowledge in FIPS and/or CC</li><li>Experience with OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language) and Go<br><br></li></ul><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. description: Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at “home.” For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. We challenge our teams to build systems that are secure-by-default and to protect our users’ most sensitive data. You will be joining a team of engineers who will champion security initiatives throughout the organization. You will be building tools to make secure-by-default easy. You will be conducting regular audits/tests to identify risks and prioritizing fixes for the identified risks. You will continue to raise the bar to make our systems secure.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Implement security best practices in our cloud and on-premise IT environment following industry standards / recommendations.</li><li>Identify vulnerabilities, missing patches, and misconfigurations across our cloud, on-premise, and employee infrastructure and ensure there is a scalable approach to prioritizing fixes for any issues identified.</li><li>Implement various types of scanning in our CI/CD pipelines and ensure results are appropriately surfaced to developers.</li><li>Ensure relevant audit and security logs are collected to a central location and exposed to the correct teams for triage, analysis, and incident response.</li><li>Work with auditors and compliance teams to meet required policies and collect required evidence.</li><li>Work with infrastructure engineering teams to ensure that all endpoints throughout the organization are configured with industry aligned security standards, that they have the relevant security tools (MDM, EDR, etc.) installed, and that administrative rights are not needed for non-power users.</li><li>Actively participate in the design and implementation of applications, services, and infrastructure to ensure security and privacy design principles are being followed.</li><li>Triage, escalate, and remediate vulnerabilities found as part of our bug bounty program.</li><li>Work with the product management teams to prioritize fixes for vulnerabilities and work with engineering teams to understand how to fix these issues.</li><li>Get your hands dirty by fixing vulnerabilities, building in security telemetry/instrumentation, and adding security features to our products/applications.</li><li>Design tooling and frameworks to make adoption of security best practices easier for developers when working in our code bases.</li><li>Deploy, manage, and tune infrastructure used to protect our applications from common vulnerability exploitation, account takeover, and denial of service attacks.</li><li>Assist in the creation and maintenance of security training</li><li>Actively participate in all facets of the incident response lifecycle by participating in a 24/7 on-call rotation.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Who You Are<br></u></strong><ul><li>You have a BS or an MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Cyber Security, or a related field</li><li>You have 5+ years of experience working on a security team supporting product/engineering functions, cloud infrastructure, and corporate infrastructure development</li><li>You have in-depth knowledge of security threats, applied cryptography, and risk assessments</li><li>You have hands-on experience in AWS specifically with one or more of the following AWS services: GuardDuty, Config, WAF, Shield, Macie, CloudTrail, SecurityHub.</li><li>You have hands-on experience writing infrastructure-as-code in languages such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Helm, etc.</li><li>You have software engineering experience (Python/Java/Scala/Ruby preferred) and an engineering mindset for building reliable and maintainable security infrastructure to support a large organization with CI/CD software engineering practices</li><li>You have experience working with product development teams to empower them on advancing security initiatives</li><li>You are familiar with the OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and how to remediate them</li><li>You are familiar with authentication and authorization frameworks or standards such as OAuth, OIDC, SAML, etc.</li><li>You have a willingness to learn and apply new skills and technologies</li><li>You have hands-on experience working with container technologies and Kubernetes</li><li>You have hands-on experience with data analytics and observability concepts and associated tooling (SQL, Looker/Tableau, Grafana LGTM stack, NewRelic, etc.)</li><li>Experience defining and implementing internal practices and controls for the PCI-DSS and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) information security and compliance standards is a plus</li><li>Experience presenting at industry conferences or contributing to open source communities is a plus</li><li>Experience with penetration testing methodologies and tools (BurpSuite, OWASP Zap, etc.) is a plus</li><li>Experience with infrastructure vulnerability scanning tools (Qualys, Rapid7, Tenable, etc.) is a plus</li><li>Experience with static analysis tools (Qwiet.ai, ShiftLeft, Fortify, Veracode, Snyk, etc.) is a plus<br></li></ul><strong>We value diversity<br><br></strong>We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.<br><br><strong><u>Compensation &amp; Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>The salary band for this position ranges from $135,000 - $170,000 commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living. </li><li>This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus &amp; equity package. </li><li>Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs </li><li>Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it </li><li>Pet discount plans &amp; retirement plan with company match (401K) </li><li>The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world <br></li></ul>#BI-Remote<br><br>

title: CNC Programmer
description: The CNC Programmer is responsible for all CNC programs for manufacturing equipment directly impacting the overall performance objectives for the company and compliance to AS9100 and NADCAP requirements and/or division. This position significantly impacts Rexnord’s ability in the areas of Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost. This position reports to the Value Stream Manager and is a Non-Exempt hourly technical position.<br><br><strong>Key Accountabilities<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to write programs that will machine complex parts to very close tolerances on multiple axes on various machining centers. </li><li>Horizontal Machining Centers including Macro, sub program and variable programming knowledge. </li><li>4 axis lathes, 5 axis lathes, Y axis lathes, and Vertical Machining Centers large and small</li><li>“Shop Floor” problem solving. </li><li>Kaizen participation such as SMDE, VSM, 5s, ect... </li><li>Maintain program library's and revision status of program revisions per NADCAP requirements. </li><li>Hands on knowledge of the programs storage and the ability to assist shop associates in uploading and downloading programs<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>This position requires the applicant to be a US Person with a US permanent residence. A US Person is a US Citizen or Green card holder</li><li>Bachelor degree in a technical field desired or 5+ years of manufacturing or industrial technical field, programming CNC equipment is required</li><li>Minimum 2 years of experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment</li><li>Ability to extract critical data and analyze data to make informed business decisions</li><li>Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt a plus</li><li>Excellent computer skills (CAD/CAM, Auto Cad, ShopCam, Solid Works, Master Cam word processing, graphics, spreadsheet, etc.)</li><li>Skilled in- G and M code editing, Macro style programming, multi axis function(s) and Fanuc/Okuma/Mazak controllers</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in time and project management</li><li>Self starter working with little direct supervision</li><li>Team orientated with the ability to influence others without authority<br><br></li></ul><strong>Regal Rexnord Corporation</strong> <strong>(“Regal Rexnord”)</strong> is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food &amp; beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. With the announcement of the acquisition of Altra Industrial Motion, a ~$2B global business with 9,000 associates, focused on Power Transmission and Factory Automation products, Regal Rexnord will become a $7.3B company with 36,000 associates globally.<br><br>You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.<br><br>Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.<br><br><strong>Notification to Agencies</strong>: Please note that Regal Rexnord Corporation and its affiliates and subsidiaries ("Regal Rexnord") do not accept unsolicited resumes or calls from third-party recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement or similar contract and approval from HR to submit resumes for a specific requisition, Regal Rexnord will not consider or approve payment to any third-parties for hires made.<br><br>Regal Rexnord is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, ancestry, national origin, marital status, citizenship status (unless required by the applicable law or government contract), disability or protected veteran status or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Regal Rexnord is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are committed to building a team that represents diverse and inclusive backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
